{{cpp/error/error_category/title|1=operator==,!=,&lt;,&lt;=&gt;}}
{{cpp/error/error_category/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|since=c++11|1=
bool operator==( const error_category&amp; rhs ) const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=2|since=c++11|until=c++20|1=
bool operator!=( const error_category&amp; rhs ) const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=3|since=c++11|until=c++20|1=
bool operator&lt;( const error_category&amp; rhs ) const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl|num=4|since=c++20|1=
std::strong_ordering operator&lt;=&gt;( const error_category&amp; rhs ) const noexcept;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Compares to another error category.

@1@ Checks whether {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} refer to the same object.
@2@ Checks whether {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} do not refer to the same object.
@3@ Orders {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} by the order of {{c|this}} and {{c|&amp;rhs}}. Equivalent to {{c|std::less&lt;const error_category*&gt;()(this, &amp;rhs)}}.
@4@ Orders {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} by the order of {{c|this}} and {{c|&amp;rhs}}. Equivalent to {{c|std::compare_three_way()(this, &amp;rhs)}}.

{{rrev|since=c++20|
{{cpp/note synthesized compare}}
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|rhs|specifies the {{tt|error_category}} to compare}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
@1@ {{c|true}} if {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} refer to the same object, {{c|false}} otherwise.
@2@ {{c|true}} if {{c|*this}} and {{c|rhs}} do not refer to the same object, {{c|false}} otherwise.
@3@ {{c|true}} if {{c|*this}} is less than {{c|rhs}} as defined by the order of {{c|this}} and {{c|&amp;rhs}}.
@4@ {{c|std::strong_order::less}} if {{c|*this}} is less than {{c|rhs}} as defined by the order of {{c|this}} and {{c|&amp;rhs}}, otherwise {{c|std::strong_order::greater}} if {{c|rhs}} is less than {{c|*this}} in the order, otherwise {{c|std::strong_order::equal}}.
